Lesson Summary: This lesson would explore altered states of consciousness, specifically psychoactive drug use and addiction. Areas of potential instruction include describing how tolerance and addiction work physiologically and psychologically. Examining the common misconceptions about addiction. Identifying and describing the effects of depressants, stimulants and hallucinogens.
Lesson Learning Outcomes:
By the end of this lesson, students will be able to answer the following questions:

  • How does the misuse of drugs affect daily like?
  • Why is it important to know about different types of psychoactive drugs?
  • What are Biological, Psychological and Social-Cultural influences on drug use and addiction?
Lesson Educational Standards:
APA Consciousness Content Standard 3: Categories of psychoactive drugs and their effects

3.1 Characterize the major categories of psychoactive drugs and their effects.

3.2 Describe how psychoactive drugs act at the synaptic level.

3.3 Evaluate the biological and psychological effects of psychoactive drugs.

3.4 Explain how culture and expectations influence the use and experience of drugs.
